Google Language Model¶

class constraints.semantics.google_language_model.google_language_model.GoogleLanguageModel(top_n=None, top_n_per_index=None, print_step=False)[source]¶

Constraint that uses the Google 1 Billion Words Language Model to determine the difference in perplexity between x and x_adv.

Parameters

  • top_n (int) –

  • top_n_per_index (int) –

  • print_step (bool, optional) – Whether to print each step. Defaults to False.

Returns

The top_n sentences.

Raises

ValueError – If top_n or top_n_per_index are not provided.

@TODO allow user to set perplexity threshold; implement __call__.

@TODO this use of the language model only really makes sense for

adversarial examples based on word swaps

call_many(x, x_adv_list, original_text=None)[source]¶

Returns the top_n of x_adv_list, as evaluated by the language model.

Parameters

  • x –

  • X_adv_list –

  • original_text (type, optional) – Defaults to None.

Author: Moustafa Alzantot (malzantot@ucla.edu) All rights reserved.

class constraints.semantics.google_language_model.alzantot_goog_lm.GoogLMHelper[source]¶

An implementation of https://arxiv.org/abs/1804.07998 adapted from https://github.com/nesl/nlp_adversarial_examples.
